question: What has to be broken before you can use it?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What month of the year has 28 days?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What question can you never answer yes to?
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
There’s a one-story house in which everything is yellow. What color are the stairs?
answer: There aren’t any—it’s a one-story house

question: What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
What goes up but never comes down?
A man who was outside in the rain without an umbrella or hat didn’t get a single hair on his head wet. Why?
What gets wet while drying?
What can you keep after giving to someone?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
You see me once in June, twice in November, and not at all in May. What am I?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for five minutes. What am I?
What invention lets you look right through a wall?
What goes up and down but doesn’t move?
If you’re running in a race and you pass the person in second place, what place are you in?
What can you catch but not throw?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
What can’t talk but will reply when spoken to?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
David’s parents have three sons: Snap, Crackle, and what’s the name of the third son?
What runs all around a backyard, yet never moves?
What can travel all around the world without leaving its corner?
What has many keys but can’t open a single lock?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
If you drop me, I’m sure to crack, but give me a smile and I’ll always smile back. What am I?
The more of this you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
People buy me to eat, but never eat me. What am I?
What building has the most stories?
What kind of coat is best put on wet?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
What has words, but never speaks?
If two’s company and three’s a crowd, what are four and five?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What is always moving but never gets tired?
What has one head, one foot, and four legs?
What has a heart that doesn’t beat?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
The more you take away, the bigger I get. What am I?
Where does today come before yesterday?
What has hands but can’t clap?
What goes through cities and fields but never moves?
What has a neck but no head?
What comes down but never goes up?
What has four fingers and a thumb, but is not alive?
What begins and has no end, and is the end of all that begins?
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks?
What’s black and white and read all over?
I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but you can’t go outside. What am I?
I’m an odd number. Take away one letter and I become even. What number am I?
Forward I am heavy, backward I am not. What am I?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have nobody, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
You see a sequence: 1, 11, 21, 1211, 111221... What comes next?
I am always hungry and will die if not fed, yet I live on what you leave behind. What am I?
What 3 positive numbers give the same result when multiplied and added together?
I’m weightless, but you can see me. If you put me in a bucket I make it lighter. What am I?
A man pushes his car to a hotel and loses his fortune. Why?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water. What am I?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
Two in a corner, one in a room, zero in a house, but one in a shelter. What is it?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I am not alive but grow; I don’t have lungs but need air; I don’t have a mouth but water kills me. What am I?
If you have me you want to share me; if you share me you don’t have me. What am I?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
The person who makes it sells it. The person who buys it never uses it. The person who uses it never sees it. What is it?
I run all around the backyard, yet never move. What am I?
I start with an “e” and end with an “e” but usually contain only one letter. What am I?
If you multiply me by any other number, the answer will always be the same. What number am I?
I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone, and cities with no people. What am I?
Take off my skin — I won’t cry, but you will. What am I?
I am greater than God, more evil than the devil, the poor have me, the rich need me, and if you eat me you’ll die. What am I?
I am always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?
Place me on a table and I’m good, eat me and I’m better, but pour me out and I’m gone forever. What am I?
A woman shoots her husband, then holds him underwater for five minutes. Finally she hangs him. But five minutes later they both go out and enjoy dinner. How is this possible?
I have a head, a tail, am brown, and have no legs. What am I?
What English word has three consecutive double letters?
Which weighs more: a pound of feathers or a pound of lead?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person cannot hold me for more than five minutes. What am I?
I am taken before you get me, and given after you lose me. What am I?
Using only addition, how do you add eight 8s to get the number 1000?
What 4-letter word can be written forward, backward or upside down, and can still be read from left to right?
I’m found in everything yet visible in none; I bring life but kill by the ton. What am I?
Two fathers and two sons go fishing. Each catches one fish, yet they bring home only three fish. How?
I am the beginning of the end, the end of time and space, the beginning of every end, and the end of every place. What am I?
What occurs once in a year, twice in a week, and never in a day?
I start small and grow; I can be quick or slow. You can’t catch me, but you can chase me. What am I?
I’m the odd one out: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 21. Which number is wrong?
What English word retains its pronunciation, even after you take away four of its five letters?
I have keys but open no locks; I have space but no room; you can enter but can’t go outside. What am I?
What 5-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
I speak in numbers and can balance both sides; accountants love me. What am I?
Two mothers and two daughters went out to eat, everyone ate one slice of pizza, but only three slices were eaten. How is this possible?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 3, 5, 9, 17, ?
I’m often served but never eaten. What am I?
I turn once, what is out will not get in. I turn again, what is in will not get out. What am I?
What has a ring but no finger?
A man walks 1 mile south, 1 mile west, and 1 mile north and returns to the same spot. How is this possible?
What can be measured but has no length, width, or height and always moves forward?
I have holes in my top, bottom and sides. I wear a crown yet I’m kingless. What am I?
What number do you get when you multiply all of the numbers on a telephone keypad?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What am I?
Two coins add to 30 cents and one of them is not a nickel. What are the coins?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you no longer have me. What am I?
What english word has five letters but becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
You see a house with all four sides facing south. A bear walks right past the house. What color is the bear?
I am taken from a mine and shut in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone and cities with no people. What am I?
What begins with t, ends with t, and has t in it?
I am not alive but I grow; I don’t have lungs but I need air; I don’t have a mouth but water kills me. What am I?
A man pushes his car to a hotel and loses his fortune. Why?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and water but no fish?
What 4-letter word can be written forward, backward, or upside down and still read the same?
I am the beginning of the end and the end of time and space. I am essential to life but also to the grave. What am I?
If two’s company and three’s a crowd, what are four and five?
What occurs once in a minute, twice in a moment, and never in a thousand years?
I am always hungry and must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
You see a sequence: 2, 3, 5, 9, 17... what is next?
What number when multiplied by any other number gives the same result?
I have a head and a tail but no body. What am I?
What goes up and down without moving?
I can be long or short; I can be grown or bought; I can be painted or left bare. What am I?
What word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
I am always coming but never arrive. What am I?
If you rearrange the letters 'lives' you get 'evils'. What do you get if you rearrange 'silent'?
A word I know, six letters it contains, remove one letter and twelve remains. What is it?
I go up and down the stairs without moving. What am I?
What English word retains its pronunciation even after you take away four of its five letters?
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. Wherever I go darkness follows me. What am I?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters?
What has a neck but no head?
I’m first in earth, second in sky, last in ocean, and found in apple pie. What letter am I?
I have rivers but no water, forests but no trees, and roads but no vehicles. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What belongs to you but other people use it more than you do?
You’re in a race and you pass the person in second place. What place are you in?
What has many keys but opens no locks?
I can be cracked, I can be made, I can be told, I can be played. What am I?
What gets wetter as it dries?
I have four legs in the morning, two at noon, and three in the evening. What am I?
I am light as a feather, yet even the strongest man cannot hold me for long. What am I?
